content.description: Route ascends large left facing off-width dihedral to a large ledge with a three bolt anchor.  Crux is the final off-width section.
content.protection: Large to medium hexes and/or cams.  There is also a bolted route to the left, where one could combine the lower sport route (2-3 bolts) then traverse into the dihedral.
content.location: Southwest end of the northern most Little Tongue River crag.  This crag is visible immediately to the east of the highway as one approaches the parking area from Steamboat Point.

content.description: An easy 5th class slab leads to a ledge below a 3-4' roof (5.8) overcome by secure fist jams and mantling followed by a fun hand jamming romp (5.6) up to a large ledge with a three bolt anchor.  A 60 m rope is barely sufficient to rappel from these anchors (tie your ends).
content.protection: Protects OK.  Hand-sized cams or hexes.  The easy lower slabs are difficult to protect.
content.location: Southwest side of the northern most Little Tongue River crag.  Located about 30' to the left of 'Off Wits'.
